title: Variable REMOVED (Emon.rsussi)
Comment: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of an ocean grid cell covered by sea ice, including snow. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.
Long name: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over Sea Ice
Processing notes: other than the different rule for spatial averaging, the variable is equivalent to Amon.rsus.

title: Variable REMOVED (Emon.rsdssi)
Comment: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of an ocean grid cell covered by sea ice, including snow. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.
Long name: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over Sea Ice
Processing notes: other than the different rule for spatial averaging, the variable is equivalent to Amon.rsds.

title: Variable REMOVED (Emon.netAtmosLandCO2Flux)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Flux of carbon as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral_carbon_transfer_over_land term, see below, will be zero data).
Long name: Net Flux of CO2 Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable REMOVED (Emon.fg14co2)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Gas exchange flux of carbon-14 as CO2 (positive into ocean)
Long name: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon-14 as 14CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable REMOVED (Emon.cWood)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Carbon mass per unit area in wood, including sapwood and hardwood.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean

title: Variable REMOVED (Emon.albsrfc)
Comment: surface albedo at grid cell level (i.e. the albedo averaged over all potential subgrid-scale structures) over all wave-bands; this shall apply to all realms (land, ocean, sea ice, land ice)
Processing notes: There is a variable AERmon.albsrfc, but I am not sure whether the definition applies to the description above; furthermore, the variable would also be of relevance outside of the AER focus, hence we may consider whether it should go into another category as well (I had Emon in mind.); Whether this variable should be provided at atmosphere/land or ocean grid, and the respective grid cell metrics, must be discussed.

title: Variable REMOVED (Emon.albsn)
Comment: This is similar to Eday.albsn, but providing monthly averages

title: Variable REMOVED (6hr.wpp)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Wave period associated with the most energetic waves in total wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves.
Processing notes: The 3-hourly version of this variable is preferable for the science goals, but if this is not possible the 6-hourly version may be archived instead. Please do not provide both.

title: Variable REMOVED (6hr.wpdir)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves, by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.
Processing notes: The 3-hourly version of this variable is preferable for the science goals, but if this is not possible the 6-hourly version may be archived instead. Please do not provide both.

title: Variable REMOVED (6hr.wdir)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.
Processing notes: The 3-hourly version of this variable is preferable for the science goals, but if this is not possible the 6-hourly version may be archived instead. Please do not provide both.

title: Variable REMOVED (6hr.swh)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This is a key parameter for describing wave energy and is derived from the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wave spectrum.
Processing notes: The 3-hourly version of this variable is preferable for the science goals, but if this is not possible the 6-hourly version may be archived instead. Please do not provide both.

title: Variable REMOVED (6hr.mpw)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.
Processing notes: The 3-hourly version of this variable is preferable for the science goals, but if this is not possible the 6-hourly version may be archived instead. Please do not provide both.

title: Variable REMOVED (3hrPt.wpp)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Wave period associated with the most energetic waves in total wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves.

title: Variable REMOVED (3hrPt.wpdir)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves, by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

title: Variable REMOVED (3hrPt.wdir)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

title: Variable REMOVED (3hrPt.swh)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This is a key parameter for describing wave energy and is derived from the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wave spectrum.

title: Variable REMOVED (3hrPt.mpw)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.
